Article.ArticleTitle: Soil to plant transfer of <sup>226</sup>Ra, <sup>232</sup>Th and <sup>137</sup>Cs to some medicinal and aromatic plants growing in Bitlis (Turkey).

AbstractText: Medicinal plants consumed in Bitlis were analysed for <sup>226</sup>Ra, <sup>232</sup>Th and <sup>137</sup>Cs using HPGe gamma spectroscopy system. Both plant samples and the corresponding soils were analysed. Using these values, the transfer factors for <sup>226</sup>Ra, <sup>232</sup>Th and <sup>137</sup>Cs were calculated in the ranges of (0.09-2.18), (0.01-0.19) and (0.01-2.8), respectively. Based on the plant concentrations observed, unless consumed in excessive amounts, these medicinal plants do not have any radiological harm to health.
